text: I have the great good fortune of being
buddies with Nicholas Kristof who is a
columnist for The New York Times and he
said a colleague of mine from the New
York Times would love to be in touch and
I thought he was very calculated he was
very smart and creating allegiances and
relationships throughout a variety of
industries that he used as cover for his
bad behavior the power of the Harvey
story and the power of the stories that
have come since is the pattern it was
eerie how similar the stories of
predation were and especially now that
the stories have come out about all of
these other male figures who it turns
out we're doing very similar things for
all of these years there's a lot of
systems in place that allowed these men
to continue to to perpetuate this
harassment against women and get away
with it there really was a business
calculation that was being made at these
companies and while they said that
issues of sexual harassment would be
taken very seriously and that they were
committed to creating a workplace that
was respectful and it was a place that
women would feel comfortable and safe
then at the same time they were looking
and they saw that Roger Ailes had just
left megyn kelly had just left bill
o'reilly was their biggest star and he
pulled in hundreds of millions of
dollars a year for them and that was
more important to them and it does feel
like there is a lot more journalistic
work to do at in different place as a
another end of the economic spectrum of
course the emphasis there is that
low-income workers often have very
little recourse and be you know the if
they don't you know have the same level
of job choice if they don't have the
same kinds of resources it can be
incredibly difficult to stand up to
somebody or to have you know any agency
at all we can't just stop by sort of
revealing allegations against
individuals we have to start to kind of
piece together and peel back the layers
of feo systemic failures and and and
really push this conversation for
into solutions system not just systemic
failures but systemic solutions that go
beyond women you know women bonding you
know banding together at workplace
